title: Test
text: We need to test the inequality to determine the signage. Plug the point $$(0,0)$$ into the equation twice, once with the equation being $$y>2x-4$$, and once with $$y<2x-4$$.

title: Find the correct sign
text: In this case, when substituting $$(0,0)$$ into the equation, does $$y>2x-4$$ result in a true statement, or does $$y<2x-4$$.
speech: In this case, when substituting  times, parentheses 0 comma 0,   into the equation, does  y is greater than 2 x minus 4  result in a true statement, or does  y is less than, 2 x minus 4 .

title: Determine line type
text: If the line is solid, the sign will include the values of the line. In other words, the sign will be greater than or equal to, or less than or equal to. If the line is dotted, the sign will simply be > or <.
speech: If the line is solid, the sign will include the values of the line. In other words, the sign will be greater than or equal to, or less than or equal to. If the line is dotted, the sign will simply be > or <.

title: Answer
text: Therefore, the equation for the inequality is $$y \leq \frac{-x}{3}-2$$
speech: Therefore, the equation for the inequality is  y is less than or equal to fraction, negative x, over 3,  minus 2
